definition: yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: In the fall we sometimes hear honks as a flock of geese flies south.
sentences.chinese: 到了秋天，有时我们能听到南飞雁群的叫声。

sentences.english: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声在震耳的雷声中变得低沉了。

sentences.english: He like dogs, but I can never stand the yelping.
sentences.chinese: 他喜欢狗，但我实在受不了那汪汪的叫声。

sentences.english: The next day the hunter lured the quails with his quail call as usual.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，猎人照常利用叫声来引诱鹌鹑。

sentences.english: Soon, the villa came the dull sound of dogs barking a few.
sentences.chinese: 不一会儿，别墅里传出数声沉闷的狗叫声。

sentences.english: She complained to the police about the barking of her neighbour's dog.
sentences.chinese: 她向警方抱怨邻居家的狗叫声。

sentences.english: In the country, he can hear the birds singing and sheep bleating .
sentences.chinese: 在乡下，他能听到鸟儿歌唱和羊的叫声。

sentences.english: The bark of the muntjac was believed to waken the sun.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信山羌的吠叫声可以唤醒太阳。

sentences.english: He was howled away when stepping into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他刚一走进屋就被轻蔑的吼叫声轰了出来。

sentences.english: All the people can hear the birds singing.
He must have heard the bleating of the sacrificial Iambs waiting to be killed.
sentences.chinese: 他一定听到等待被宰的羔羊的叫声。
珂赛特发出一声凄厉的叫声。

sentences.english: Nothing gets vultures squawking louder with delight than a wave of forced selling.
sentences.chinese: 只有被迫出售才能是这些秃鹫发出愉快的叫声。

sentences.english: Josh and Zuleika hear the scream through the trees.
sentences.chinese: 杰克和奈提莉听到有尖叫声穿过树林。

sentences.english: Some animals' voices are high-pitched, others are low.
sentences.chinese: 一些动物的叫声很尖锐，别的很低沉。

sentences.english: Fuel pump is humming call blocking as a vacuum pump was caused by smoking.
sentences.chinese: 汽油泵嗡嗡叫声是因阻塞油泵被抽成真空所引起。

definition: to cry out/to bark out a sound
to whinny (of a horse)/to neigh/to shout
to emit a sound/(of birds, insects etc) to chirp, hoot etc/(of a siren, steam whistle etc) to sound
